intro: Sida retusifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Sida retusifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
